46:59 Caption: The opening 45 minutes weren't very eventful and the game could be described as an average one. The visiting team dominated the first half in most aspects of the game, but the hosts will surely attempt to turn the situation in their favour. The home team tries to find the weakness in the opposition's defence, especially with rapid counter-attacks, while the away team play possession football.

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Sevilla suffered a hard-fought defeat against Real Madrid in a thrilling match that concluded with a scoreline of 2-3 in favor of the visitors. The game, played in front of a passionate crowd, showcased moments of impeccable skill, dramatic injuries, and a flurry of goals that had fans on the edge of their seats throughout the match.

The match began with Sevilla kicking off at the designated time and, almost immediately, the ball went out of play setting the tone for a highly dynamic encounter. Sevilla had the first significant opportunity of the match with a corner, but it was well defended by their opponents. Real Madrid responded quickly with a shot off target just under two minutes into the game after having a direct free-kick.

As the tempo of the game increased, fouls became a common occurrence. Within the initial few minutes, Sevilla committed several fouls, leading to indirect free-kicks for Real Madrid, although no substantial chances materialized from these set pieces. The scrappy nature of the early minutes continued with throw-ins and clearances frequently punctuating the play.

Despite Real Madrid showing glimpses of their attacking flair with a succession of shots, none found the back of the net early on. It was Cristiano Ronaldo who had the first real shot on target just before the ten-minute mark, making the Sevilla defense alert and cautious.

At one point, Cristiano Ronaldo managed to maneuver the ball into the penalty area, requiring a clearance from the Sevilla defenders. In another scenario, Aleix Vidal showcased his tactical prowess by taking a shot that was blocked by Real Madrid's staunch defense. It wasn't until the 35th minute that Cristiano Ronaldo broke the deadlock. Capitalizing on a precise cross from Isco, Cristiano Ronaldo executed a powerful header from the center of the box leaving Sevilla goalkeeper Sergio Rico with no chance.

Moments later, Real Madrid displayed their dominance as they swiftly doubled their lead. Chicharito connected with a well-timed header over the defense straight to Cristiano Ronaldo, who made no mistake firing it into the back of the net. Sevilla found themselves trailing 0-2 within a couple of relentless minutes, forcing them to regroup and rethink their strategies.

Sevilla's attempts to break through Real Madrid's solid defense were met with some success after Stephane Mbia tried an ambitious shot only to see it fly high over the bar. Continuing to mount pressure, Sevilla almost clawed their way back into the game just before halftime. They were awarded a penalty following a reckless challenge by Sergio Ramos but Sergio Ramos received a yellow card for his heavily mistimed tackle. Carlos Bacca stepped up and calmly slotted the penalty into the right corner of the net, reducing Real Madrid's lead to 1-2 just before the half-time whistle blew.

The first half concluded with Real Madrid maintaining control yet showing a few frailties in defense that Sevilla sought to exploit. The second half began with Real Madrid kicking off and set a quick pace. Despite Sevilla's efforts to mount an immediate comeback, their attacks were consistently thwarted by Real Madrid's defensive resilience. Early on in the second half, a sequence of corner kicks presented opportunities for Sevilla but Real Madrid's defense remained impenetrable.

Both teams continued to battle with Sevilla gradually finding more rhythm in their play. Sevilla nearly found an equalizer with a lofted cross by Carlos Bacca that required an alert clearance by Real Madrid. As the half trudged along, the intensity of the match doubled with players from both sides committing fouls and earning yellow cards as they fought for control of the midfield.

In the 21st minute, Cristiano Ronaldo came close again, but a well-timed intervention by Sergio Rico foiled his attempt. Cristiano Ronaldo, however, was not to be denied a third time. In the 23rd minute, Gareth Bale's superb cross found Ronaldo again, and the Portuguese striker expertly placed his header inside the right post securing his hat-trick and extending Real Madrid's lead to 1-3.

Sevilla did not lose hope. Unai Emery made strategic substitutions bringing on Denis Suarez and Kevin Gameiro to inject some fresh energy into the squad. The changes bore fruit in the 33rd minute when Iborra, who had just come on, latched onto a brilliant pass from Aleix Vidal and fired a first-time shot into the net making it 2-3, giving the Sevilla fans renewed belief.

Real Madrid, sensing the need for reinforcement, substituted Isco for Asier Illarramendi and Marcelo for Alvaro Arbeloa to shore up their defense. Sevilla continued their attacking pursuits with renewed vigor, creating multiple opportunities and forcing several corners in the closing minutes of the match.

As the game entered its final phase, tensions ran high with a series of fouls resulting in more yellow cards, particularly for Sevilla players who seemed frustrated by Real Madrid's defensive fortitude. Despite their best efforts, Sevilla could not break through again. Real Madrid's defense, led by Iker Casillas, managed to repel several close-range efforts including a dangerous header attempt by Iborra which was brilliantly saved by Casillas at the very last moment.

The match concluded with Real Madrid emerging as victors with a final scoreline of 2-3 in their favor. While Sevilla had moments of brilliance and fought valiantly, it was the clinical finishing and defensive solidity of Real Madrid that ultimately secured the win. The game provided a feast of football, filled with dramatic turns, and individual moments of genius, particularly from Cristiano Ronaldo who was undoubtedly the star of the match with his hat-trick performance.

In conclusion, this match was a testament to the high stakes and competitive nature of top-flight football. It was an encounter that highlighted Real Madrid's tactical supremacy and superior finishing ability, while also exposing the resilience and fighting spirit of Sevilla, who despite the loss, showcased their capability to challenge even the most formidable of opponents.
